trans-unit.source: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on Linux-based HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on Linux-based HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy, monitor and manage Apache Storm topologies using the Storm Dashboard on Linux-based HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy, monitor and manage Apache Storm topologies using the Storm Dashboard on Linux-based HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on Linux-based HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on Linux-based HDInsight

trans-unit.source: In this document, learn the basics of managing and monitoring Storm topologies running on Linux-based Storm on HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: In this document, learn the basics of managing and monitoring Storm topologies running on Linux-based Storm on HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The steps in this article require a Linux-based Storm on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The steps in this article require a Linux-based Storm on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on deploying and monitoring topologies on Windows-based HDInsight, see [Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on Windows-based HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-deploy-monitor-topology.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on deploying and monitoring topologies on Windows-based HDInsight, see [Deploy and manage Apache Storm topologies on Windows-based HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-deploy-monitor-topology.md)

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: **A Linux-based Storm on HDInsight cluster**: see [Get started with Apache Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started-linux.md) for steps on creating a cluster
trans-unit.target: **A Linux-based Storm on HDInsight cluster**: see [Get started with Apache Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started-linux.md) for steps on creating a cluster

trans-unit.source: **Familiarity with SSH and SCP**: For more information on using SSH and SCP with HDInsight, see the following:
trans-unit.target: **Familiarity with SSH and SCP**: For more information on using SSH and SCP with HDInsight, see the following:

trans-unit.source: **Linux, Unix or OS X clients**: See [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X or Unix](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: **Linux, Unix or OS X clients**: See [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X or Unix](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: **Windows clients**: See [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: **Windows clients**: See [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: **An SCP client**: This is provided with all Linux, Unix, and OS X systems.
trans-unit.target: **An SCP client**: This is provided with all Linux, Unix, and OS X systems.

trans-unit.source: For Windows clients, we recommend PSCP, which is available from the [PuTTY download page](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).
trans-unit.target: For Windows clients, we recommend PSCP, which is available from the [PuTTY download page](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).

trans-unit.source: Start a Storm topology
trans-unit.target: Start a Storm topology

trans-unit.source: Use SSH to connect to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH to connect to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Replace **USERNAME** the the name of your SSH login.
trans-unit.target: Replace **USERNAME** the the name of your SSH login.

trans-unit.source: Replace **CLUSTERNAME** with your HDInsight cluster name:
trans-unit.target: Replace **CLUSTERNAME** with your HDInsight cluster name:

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH to connect to your HDInsight cluster, see the following documents:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH to connect to your HDInsight cluster, see the following documents:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to start an example topology:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to start an example topology:

trans-unit.source: This will start the example WordCount topology on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This will start the example WordCount topology on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: It will randomly generate sentences and count the occurrance of each word in the sentences.
trans-unit.target: It will randomly generate sentences and count the occurrance of each word in the sentences.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When submitting topology to the cluster, you must first copy the jar file containing the cluster before using the `storm` command.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When submitting topology to the cluster, you must first copy the jar file containing the cluster before using the `storm` command.

trans-unit.source: This can be accomplished using the `scp` command from the client where the file exists.
trans-unit.target: This can be accomplished using the `scp` command from the client where the file exists.

trans-unit.source: For example, `scp FILENAME.jar USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:FILENAME.jar`
trans-unit.target: For example, `scp FILENAME.jar USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:FILENAME.jar`

trans-unit.source: The WordCount example, and other storm starter examples, are already included on your cluster at `/usr/hdp/current/storm-client/contrib/storm-starter/`.
trans-unit.target: The WordCount example, and other storm starter examples, are already included on your cluster at `/usr/hdp/current/storm-client/contrib/storm-starter/`.

trans-unit.source: Monitor and manage using the storm command
trans-unit.target: Monitor and manage using the storm command

trans-unit.source: The `storm` utility allows you to work with running topologies from the command line.
trans-unit.target: The `storm` utility allows you to work with running topologies from the command line.

trans-unit.source: The following is a list of commonly used commands.
trans-unit.target: The following is a list of commonly used commands.

trans-unit.source: Use `storm -h` for a full list of commands.
trans-unit.target: Use `storm -h` for a full list of commands.

trans-unit.source: List topologies
trans-unit.target: List topologies

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to list all running topologies:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to list all running topologies:

trans-unit.source: This will return information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This will return information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Deactivate and reactivate
trans-unit.target: Deactivate and reactivate

trans-unit.source: Deactivating a topology pauses it until it is killed or reactivated.
trans-unit.target: Deactivating a topology pauses it until it is killed or reactivated.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to deactivate and reactivate:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to deactivate and reactivate:

trans-unit.source: Kill a running topology
trans-unit.target: Kill a running topology

trans-unit.source: Storm topologies, once started, will continue running until stopped.
trans-unit.target: Storm topologies, once started, will continue running until stopped.

trans-unit.source: To stop a topology, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To stop a topology, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: Rebalance
trans-unit.target: Rebalance

trans-unit.source: Rebalancing a topology allows the system to revise the parallelism of the topology.
trans-unit.target: Rebalancing a topology allows the system to revise the parallelism of the topology.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have resized the cluster to add more notes, rebalancing will allow a running topology to make use of the new nodes.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have resized the cluster to add more notes, rebalancing will allow a running topology to make use of the new nodes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Rebalancing a topology first deactivates the topology, then redistributes workers evenly across the cluster, then finally returns the topology to the state it was in before rebalancing occurred.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Rebalancing a topology first deactivates the topology, then redistributes workers evenly across the cluster, then finally returns the topology to the state it was in before rebalancing occurred.

trans-unit.source: So if the topology was active, it will become active again.
trans-unit.target: So if the topology was active, it will become active again.

trans-unit.source: If it was deactivated, it will remain deactivated.
trans-unit.target: If it was deactivated, it will remain deactivated.

trans-unit.source: Monitor and manage using the Storm UI
trans-unit.target: Monitor and manage using the Storm UI

trans-unit.source: The Storm UI provides a web interface for working with running topologies, and is included on your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Storm UI provides a web interface for working with running topologies, and is included on your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To view the Storm UI, use a web browser to open __https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/stormui__, where __CLUSTERNAME__ is the name of your cluster.
trans-unit.target: To view the Storm UI, use a web browser to open __https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/stormui__, where __CLUSTERNAME__ is the name of your cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If asked to provide a user name and password, enter the cluster administrator (admin) and password that you used when creating the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If asked to provide a user name and password, enter the cluster administrator (admin) and password that you used when creating the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Main page
trans-unit.target: Main page

trans-unit.source: The main page of the Storm UI provides the following information:
trans-unit.target: The main page of the Storm UI provides the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Cluster summary**: Basic information about the Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster summary**: Basic information about the Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Topology summary**: A list of running topologies.
trans-unit.target: **Topology summary**: A list of running topologies.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific topologies.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific topologies.

trans-unit.source: **Supervisor summary**: Information about the Storm supervisor.
trans-unit.target: **Supervisor summary**: Information about the Storm supervisor.

trans-unit.source: **Nimbus configuration**: Nimbus configuration for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Nimbus configuration**: Nimbus configuration for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Topology summary
trans-unit.target: Topology summary

trans-unit.source: Selecting a link from the **Topology summary** section displays the following information about the topology:
trans-unit.target: Selecting a link from the **Topology summary** section displays the following information about the topology:

trans-unit.source: **Topology summary**: Basic information about the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology summary**: Basic information about the topology.

trans-unit.source: **Topology actions**: Management actions that you can perform for the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology actions**: Management actions that you can perform for the topology.

trans-unit.source: **Activate**: Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.
trans-unit.target: **Activate**: Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.

trans-unit.source: **Deactivate**: Pauses a running topology.
trans-unit.target: **Deactivate**: Pauses a running topology.

trans-unit.source: **Rebalance**: Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Rebalance**: Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.

trans-unit.source: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased or decreased number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased or decreased number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology.

trans-unit.source: **Kill**: Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.
trans-unit.target: **Kill**: Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.

trans-unit.source: **Topology stats**: Statistics about the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology stats**: Statistics about the topology.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.

trans-unit.source: **Spouts**: The spouts used by the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Spouts**: The spouts used by the topology.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific spouts.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific spouts.

trans-unit.source: **Bolts**: The bolts used by the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Bolts**: The bolts used by the topology.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific bolts.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in this section to view more information about specific bolts.

trans-unit.source: **Topology configuration**: The configuration of the selected topology.
trans-unit.target: **Topology configuration**: The configuration of the selected topology.

trans-unit.source: Spout and Bolt summary
trans-unit.target: Spout and Bolt summary

trans-unit.source: Selecting a spout from the **Spouts** or **Bolts** sections displays the following information about the selected item:
trans-unit.target: Selecting a spout from the **Spouts** or **Bolts** sections displays the following information about the selected item:

trans-unit.source: **Component summary**: Basic information about the spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Component summary**: Basic information about the spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Spout/Bolt stats**: Statistics about the spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Spout/Bolt stats**: Statistics about the spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.
trans-unit.target: Use the links in the **Window** column to set the timeframe for the remaining entries on the page.

trans-unit.source: **Input stats** (bolt only): Information about the input streams consumed by the bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Input stats** (bolt only): Information about the input streams consumed by the bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Output stats**: Information about the streams emitted by this spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Output stats**: Information about the streams emitted by this spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Executors**: Information about the instances of the spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Executors**: Information about the instances of the spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Port** entry for a specific executor to view a log of diagnostic information produced for this instance.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Port** entry for a specific executor to view a log of diagnostic information produced for this instance.

trans-unit.source: **Errors**: Any error information for this spout or bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Errors**: Any error information for this spout or bolt.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: The Storm UI is built on top of the REST API, so you can perform similar management and monitoring functionality by using the REST API.
trans-unit.target: The Storm UI is built on top of the REST API, so you can perform similar management and monitoring functionality by using the REST API.

trans-unit.source: You can use the REST API to create custom tools for managing and monitoring Storm topologies.
trans-unit.target: You can use the REST API to create custom tools for managing and monitoring Storm topologies.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Storm UI REST API](https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/master/docs/documentation/ui-rest-api.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Storm UI REST API](https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/master/docs/documentation/ui-rest-api.md).

trans-unit.source: The following information is specific to using the REST API with Apache Storm on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The following information is specific to using the REST API with Apache Storm on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The Storm REST API is not publicly available over the internet, and must be accessed using an SSH tunnel to the HDInsight cluster head node.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The Storm REST API is not publicly available over the internet, and must be accessed using an SSH tunnel to the HDInsight cluster head node.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating and using an SSH tunnel, see [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on creating and using an SSH tunnel, see [Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's](hdinsight-linux-ambari-ssh-tunnel.md).

trans-unit.source: Base URI
trans-unit.target: Base URI

trans-unit.source: The base URI for the REST API on Linux-based HDInsight clusters is available on the head node at **https://HEADNODEFQDN:8744/api/v1/**; however, the domain name of the head node is generated during cluster creation and is not static.
trans-unit.target: The base URI for the REST API on Linux-based HDInsight clusters is available on the head node at **https://HEADNODEFQDN:8744/api/v1/**; however, the domain name of the head node is generated during cluster creation and is not static.

trans-unit.source: You can find the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the cluster head node in several different ways:
trans-unit.target: You can find the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the cluster head node in several different ways:

trans-unit.source: __From an SSH session__: Use the command `headnode -f` from an SSH session to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: __From an SSH session__: Use the command `headnode -f` from an SSH session to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: __From Ambari Web__: Select __Services__ from the top of the page, then select __Storm__.
trans-unit.target: __From Ambari Web__: Select __Services__ from the top of the page, then select __Storm__.

trans-unit.source: From the __Summary__ tab, select __Storm UI Server__.
trans-unit.target: From the __Summary__ tab, select __Storm UI Server__.

trans-unit.source: The FQDN of the node that the Storm UI and REST API is running on will be at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: The FQDN of the node that the Storm UI and REST API is running on will be at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: __From Ambari REST API__: Use the command `curl -u admin:PASSWORD -G "https://CLUSTERNAME .azurehdinsight.net/api/v1/clusters/CLUSTERNAME/services/STORM/components/STORM_UI_SERVER"` to retrieve information about the node that the Storm UI and REST API are running on.
trans-unit.target: __From Ambari REST API__: Use the command `curl -u admin:PASSWORD -G "https://CLUSTERNAME .azurehdinsight.net/api/v1/clusters/CLUSTERNAME/services/STORM/components/STORM_UI_SERVER"` to retrieve information about the node that the Storm UI and REST API are running on.

trans-unit.source: Replace __PASSWORD__ with the admin password for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace __PASSWORD__ with the admin password for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Replace __CLUSTERNAME__ with the cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Replace __CLUSTERNAME__ with the cluster name.

trans-unit.source: In the response, the "host_name" entry contains the FQDN of the node.
trans-unit.target: In the response, the "host_name" entry contains the FQDN of the node.

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: Requests to the REST API must use **basic authentication**, so you use the HDInsight cluster administrator name and password.
trans-unit.target: Requests to the REST API must use **basic authentication**, so you use the HDInsight cluster administrator name and password.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Because basic authentication is sent by using clear text, you should **always** use HTTPS to secure communications with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Because basic authentication is sent by using clear text, you should **always** use HTTPS to secure communications with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Return values
trans-unit.target: Return values

trans-unit.source: Information that is returned from the REST API may only be usable from within the cluster or virtual machines on the same Azure Virtual Network as the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Information that is returned from the REST API may only be usable from within the cluster or virtual machines on the same Azure Virtual Network as the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) returned for Zookeeper servers will not be accessible from the Internet.
trans-unit.target: For example, the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) returned for Zookeeper servers will not be accessible from the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you've learned how to deploy and monitor topologies by using the Storm Dashboard, learn how to [Develop Java-based topologies using Maven](hdinsight-storm-develop-java-topology.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned how to deploy and monitor topologies by using the Storm Dashboard, learn how to [Develop Java-based topologies using Maven](hdinsight-storm-develop-java-topology.md).

trans-unit.source: For a list of more example topologies, see [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md).
trans-unit.target: For a list of more example topologies, see [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md).
